Draw the first face of the prism using the following 2D sketch measurements: - Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0]; End Point [0.4037, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.4037, 0.0]; End Point [0.4037, 0.75] - Line 3: Start Point [0.4037, 0.75]; End Point [0.0, 0.75] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75]; End Point [0.0, 0.0] 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the Euler angles (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) and the translation vector [0.0, 0.2329, 0.0]. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.2329 units in the direction of the normal vector to create the base prism. **Instructions for Part 2: Cutting a Rectangular Prism** Cut a rectangular prism out of the base prism. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0273, 0.6774] 2. Draw a rectangle using the following 2D sketch measurements: - Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0]; End Point [0.1553, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.1553, 0.0]; End Point [0.1553, 0.0388] - Line 3: Start Point [0.1553, 0.0388]; End Point [0.0, 0.0388] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0388]; End Point [0.0, 0.0] 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.1553. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the Euler angles (-90.0, 0.0, -90.0) and the translation vector [0.0, 0.0273, 0.6774]. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.4037 units along the normal direction to remove the required prism volume from the base prism. **Instructions for Part 3: Cutting a Cylindrical Hole Through the Prism** Cut a cylindrical hole through the resulting object. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.1242, 0.0388, 0.75] 2. Draw a circle in the 2D sketch with the following properties: - Center: [0.0776, 0.0776] - Radius: 0.0776 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.1553. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch. 5. Extrude the circle by 0.7453 units in the opposite direction of the normal vector to create the cylindrical hole, effectively obtaining the final shape as described.</description>
